page.title: 06Playground Rhymes
page.content: Lots of children know rhymes for skipping, clapping, dipping and ball games.(Dipping means deciding who is "on" next or who is to be the next chaser.) Here is one 1980's rhyme: {Each Peach Pear Plum {Out goes your very last chum. { {Skipping Rhymes Children often skip on their own or in small groups. Here is an example of a skipping game. (The rhyme is said by the children while turning the rope.) { All is together girls { This is fine weather girls { When it's your birthday { Please jump in. (The children turning the rope say the months of the year starting with January and jump out on their birthday)
